title: Diana Golbi
text:
Diana Golbi (; born January 16, 1992) is an Israeli singer and actress, the eighth winner of "<a href="Kokhav%20Nolad">Kokhav Nolad</a>", the Israeli version of "<a href="Pop%20Idol">Pop Idol</a>". Golbi is the third female participant to win the show (following <a href="Ninet%20Tayeb">Ninet Tayeb</a> on the first season and <a href="Roni%20Dalumi">Roni Dalumi</a> on the <a href="Kokhav%20Nolad%207">seventh season</a>).
Personal life.
Golbi was born as Diana Igorevna Golovanova () in Moscow, Russia. When she turned four, her parents decided to immigrate to Israel, and resided in the city of <a href="Holon">Holon</a>. During her childhood, Golbi "fell in love" with the stage. She studied theatre in an American studio, and when she was 12, she went to perform in a big theatre in <a href="St.%20Petersburg">St. Petersburg</a>. She served as an instructor in the <a href="C4I%20Corps">Teleprocessing Corps</a> of the <a href="Israel%20Defense%20Forces">Israel Defense Forces</a>.
Golbi also loves <a href="association%20football">football</a>. She played on a girl team in <a href="Petah%20Tikva">Petah Tikva</a>, coached by her father, even though she did prefer performing on stage. During 2008 Golbi and her friends formed a rock band, called HaRusim (Hebrew: הרוסים). HaRusim is a double meaning: it means both "The Ruined Ones" and "The Russian Ones" in Hebrew, since the members of the band are all <a href="1990s%20Post-Soviet%20aliyah">Russian</a> originally.
Studied acting in the <a href="Nissan%20Nativ%20Acting%20Studio">Nissan Nativ Acting Studio</a> in <a href="Tel%20Aviv">Tel Aviv</a> 2015-2018
"Kokhav Nolad 8".
During 2010, Golbi went to audition for the <a href="Kokhav%20Nolad%208">eighth season of "Kokhav Nolad"</a> and was accepted. In the night of September 4, 2010, she won 53% of the votes and beat <a href="Idan%20Amedi">Idan Amedi</a>, and was therefore crowned as the winner of "Kokhav Nolad 8". She won a production contract from the music producer <a href="Louis%20Lahav">Louis Lahav</a>.
"HaKokhav HaBa".
In 2017, Golbi entered the 4th season of <a href="HaKokhav%20HaBa">HaKokhav HaBa</a>. In her first performance she sang "<a href="Alive%20%28Sia%20song%29">Alive</a>", a song which was originally sung by <a href="Sia%20Furler">Sia</a>. She got a score of 95% for that performance, which was broadcast on Israeli TV on January 2, 2017. She became the runner-up of the show, after <a href="Imri%20Ziv">Imri Ziv</a>.
